intro: Arrabidaea verrucosa, commonly known as the roughleaf arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of pink or purple, and it plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
